results.title: Simvastatin regulates the proliferation, apoptosis, migration and invasion of human acute myeloid leukemia cells via miR-19a-3p/HIF-1alpha axis
results.text_hl: This study aimed to explore the bioregulation of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ and its mechanism in @<m>DISEASE_Leukemia_Myeloid_Acute</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015470 @@@acute leukemia@@@ cell lines.

results.title: The sensitivity of leukemic bone marrow to simvastatin is lost at remission: a potential purging agent for autologous bone marrow transplantation.
results.text_hl: We conclude that @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ may be an effective in vitro purging agent in ABMT for @<m>DISEASE_Leukemia_Myeloid_Acute</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015470 @@@AML@@@.

results.title: Effect of simvastatin alone and in combination with cytosine arabinoside on the proliferation of myeloid leukemia cell lines.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSIONS: We conclude that @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ has a major antiproliferative effect on @<m>DISEASE_Leukemia_Myeloid_Acute</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015470 @@@AML@@@ blasts in vitro.

citations.NLM: Lishner M, Bar-Sef A, Elis A, Fabian I. Effect of simvastatin alone and in combination with cytosine arabinoside on the proliferation of myeloid leukemia cell lines. J Investig Med. 2001 Jul;49(4):319-24. PMID: 11478407
